intro: Acrothamnus, commonly known as the golden weed or silverleaf bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the daisy family, Asteraceae. These shrubs are native to Australia and are characterized by their silvery-gray foliage and yellow flowers. Acrothamnus species typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. The plants often have a woody base with soft, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. They are sometimes used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging climates.
